channel.title: Marc Garneau
channel.description: Recent news about Marc Garneau, from openparliament.ca.

item.title: Posted on Twitter
item.description: 2/2 Keystone important for Canada but #PMSH was totally absent in terms of environmental leadership until he got scared of losing Keystone

item.title: Posted on Twitter
item.description: #PMSH has effectively abdicated leadership on environment by asking Obama what our émission targets should be for Keystone to go ahead? 1/2

item.title: Posted on Twitter
item.description: More light today on the government's total incompetence on military procurement: this time the Cyclone helicopter. Standby for excuses

item.title: Posted on Twitter
item.description: Dang! One of those moments. Set out from desk to do specific task; did 4 others along way & returned to desk having forgotten original task

item.title: Mentioned by Canada.com
item.description:
Garneau: Harper's annual photo-op belies string of broken Arctic promises
By Marc Garneau, Liberal MP. Since 2006, the Harper Conservatives have made and repeated dozens of promises about protecting Canada's Arctic sovereignty. Each summer, the prime minister makes a symbolic excursion to the North to trumpet these commitments. While the scope of the Arctic promises the Harper ... Marc Garneau is the member of Parliament for Westmount—Ville-Marie and Liberal critic for Foreign Affairs, International Trade and la Francophonie. Read more Articles from Postmedia News.

item.title: Mentioned by Hamilton Spectator
item.description:
Astronaut snub sent Canadians into orbit
OTTAWA The federal Conservatives were condemned as "childish," "petty" and "despicably partisan" after Liberal MP Marc Garneau — the first Canadian to fly in space — was snubbed from a ceremony to unveil the Canadarm at an Ottawa museum.

item.title: Mentioned by MetroNews Canada
item.description:
Canadians blasted Conservatives over snub of astronaut Marc Garneau
OTTAWA—The federal Conservatives were condemned as “childish,” “petty” and “despicably partisan” after Liberal MP Marc Garneau — the first Canadian to fly in space — was snubbed from a ceremony to unveil the Canadarm at an Ottawa museum.
